page.title: 14The Severn Bore
page.content: The reasons for the Severn's bore are 1)the funnel-shaped tidal approach up the Bristol Channel where the mass of water is squeezed between the narrowing banks and 2)the South-West orientation of the channel which directs to the mouth of the Severn the long waves which have been rolled diagonally across the Atlantic Ocean by the prevailing winds.There is a multiplicity of bores but the two or three which are most likely to be notable each March and September are forecast and groups of sightseers gather at key-points(such as by our main road between the public house,now named after the bore,and the post office)to witness the progress of what they hope will be a good,spectacular bore. On the crest of this wave,or maybe behind or even under it,canoe or surf a few daring souls.
